subtitle: This tender cut of pork makes a wonderful stuffed roll, ideal for serving cold in slices.

method.text: Cut the pork loin in half. Tenderise the two pieces by hitting gently with a meat mallet or rolling pin, until 2mm/ <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub>0 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> cm thick.
Place diced chicken in a food processor. Process until smooth. Slowly add the egg white and cream. Mix in the chopped parsley until well combined.

Place the two flattened pork loin pieces end to end. Evenly spread over the puree. Roll up to incorporate the filling, creating a Catherine wheel effect. Tie at regular intervals with lengths of kitchen string to hold in place.
Place in a roasting tin. Cook in the oven for about 15 min, until thoroughly cooked.
Serve hot or cold in slices.

title: Loin of pork
